item_prototype.name: Server {#PXNAME}/{#SVNAME} act
item_prototype.description: The server is active.

item_prototype.name: Server {#PXNAME}/{#SVNAME} bck
item_prototype.description: The server is backup.

item_prototype.name: Server {#PXNAME}/{#SVNAME} bin
item_prototype.description: The total number of bytes received.

item_prototype.name: Server {#PXNAME}/{#SVNAME} bout
item_prototype.description: The total number of bytes sent.

item_prototype.name: Server {#PXNAME}/{#SVNAME} check_code
item_prototype.description: Last health check response code.

item_prototype.name: Server {#PXNAME}/{#SVNAME} check_duration
item_prototype.description: Time in ms took to finish last health check.

item_prototype.name: Server {#PXNAME}/{#SVNAME} check_status
item_prototype.description: Status of last health check, one of: UNK -> unknown INI -> initializing SOCKERR -> socket error L4OK -> check passed on layer 4, no upper layers testing enabled L4TOUT -> layer 1-4 timeout L4CON -> layer 1-4 connection problem, for example "Connection refused" (tcp rst) or "No route to host" (icmp) L6OK -> check passed on layer 6 L6TOUT -> layer 6 (SSL) timeout L6RSP -> layer 6 invalid response - protocol error L7OK -> check passed on layer 7 L7OKC -> check conditionally passed on layer 7, for example 404 with disable-on-404 L7TOUT -> layer 7 (HTTP/SMTP) timeout L7RSP -> layer 7 invalid response - protocol error L7STS -> layer 7 response error, for example HTTP 5xx Notice: If a check is currently running, the last known status will be reported, prefixed with "* ". e. g. "* L7OK".

item_prototype.name: Server {#PXNAME}/{#SVNAME} chkdown
item_prototype.description: The number of transitions from UP to DOWN.

item_prototype.name: Server {#PXNAME}/{#SVNAME} chkfail
item_prototype.description: The number of failed health checks. (Only counts checks failed when the server is up.)

item_prototype.name: Server {#PXNAME}/{#SVNAME} comp_byp
item_prototype.description: Number of bytes that bypassed the HTTP compressor.

item_prototype.name: Server {#PXNAME}/{#SVNAME} comp_in
item_prototype.description: Total number of input compression requests.

item_prototype.name: Server {#PXNAME}/{#SVNAME} comp_out
item_prototype.description: Total number of output compression responses.

item_prototype.name: Server {#PXNAME}/{#SVNAME} comp_rsp
item_prototype.description: Number of HTTP responses that were compressed.

item_prototype.name: Server {#PXNAME}/{#SVNAME} conn_rate
item_prototype.description: Number of connections over the last elapsed second.

item_prototype.name: Server {#PXNAME}/{#SVNAME} conn_tot
item_prototype.description: Cumulative number of connections.

item_prototype.name: Server {#PXNAME}/{#SVNAME} ctime
item_prototype.description: The average connect time in ms over the 1024 last requests.

item_prototype.name: Server {#PXNAME}/{#SVNAME} dcon
item_prototype.description: Requests denied by "tcp-request connection" rules

item_prototype.name: Server {#PXNAME}/{#SVNAME} downtime
item_prototype.description: Total downtime (in seconds). The value for the backend is the downtime for the whole backend, not the sum of the server downtime.

item_prototype.name: Server {#PXNAME}/{#SVNAME} dreq
item_prototype.description: The number of requests that were rejected because of security concerns. For tcp this is because of a matched tcp-request content rule. For http this is because of a matched http-request or tarpit rule.

item_prototype.name: Server {#PXNAME}/{#SVNAME} dresp
item_prototype.description: The number of responses that were rejected because of security concerns. For http this is because of a matched http-request rule, or "option checkcache".

item_prototype.name: Server {#PXNAME}/{#SVNAME} dses
item_prototype.description: Requests denied by "tcp-request session" rules

item_prototype.name: Server {#PXNAME}/{#SVNAME} econ
item_prototype.description: Number of requests that encountered an error trying to connect to a backend server. The backend stat is the sum of the stat for all servers of that backend, plus any connection errors not associated with a particular server (such as the backend having no active servers).

item_prototype.name: Server {#PXNAME}/{#SVNAME} ereq
item_prototype.description: The number of requests that encountered an error. Some of the possible causes are: - early termination from the client, before the request has been sent. - read error from the client - client timeout - client closed connection - various bad requests from the client. - request was tarpitted.

item_prototype.name: Server {#PXNAME}/{#SVNAME} eresp
item_prototype.description: The number of responses that encountered an error. srv_abrt will be counted here also. Some other errors are: - write error on the client socket (won't be counted for the server stat) - failure applying filters to the response.

item_prototype.name: Server {#PXNAME}/{#SVNAME} hanafail
item_prototype.description: Failed health checks details.

item_prototype.name: Server {#PXNAME}/{#SVNAME} hrsp_1xx
item_prototype.description: Total number of HTTP requests that received a 1xx response.

item_prototype.name: Server {#PXNAME}/{#SVNAME} hrsp_2xx
item_prototype.description: Total number of HTTP requests that received a 2xx response.

item_prototype.name: Server {#PXNAME}/{#SVNAME} hrsp_3xx
item_prototype.description: Total number of HTTP requests that received a 3xx response.

item_prototype.name: Server {#PXNAME}/{#SVNAME} hrsp_4xx
item_prototype.description: Total number of HTTP requests that received a 4xx response.

item_prototype.name: Server {#PXNAME}/{#SVNAME} hrsp_5xx
item_prototype.description: Total number of HTTP requests that received a 5xx response.

item_prototype.name: Server {#PXNAME}/{#SVNAME} hrsp_other
item_prototype.description: HTTP responses with other codes (protocol error).

item_prototype.name: Server {#PXNAME}/{#SVNAME} lastchg
item_prototype.description: Number of seconds since the last UP<->DOWN transition.

item_prototype.name: Server {#PXNAME}/{#SVNAME} last_agt
item_prototype.description: Last agent check contents or textual error.

item_prototype.name: Server {#PXNAME}/{#SVNAME} last_chk
item_prototype.description: Last health check contents or textual error.

item_prototype.name: Server {#PXNAME}/{#SVNAME} lbtot
item_prototype.description: Total number of times a server was selected, either for new sessions, or when re-dispatching. The server counter is the number of times that server was selected.

item_prototype.name: Server {#PXNAME}/{#SVNAME} qcur
item_prototype.description: Current queued requests. For the backend this reports the number queued without a server assigned.

item_prototype.name: Server {#PXNAME}/{#SVNAME} qmax
item_prototype.description: The most connections that have ever been queued at once. Only for backend

item_prototype.name: Server {#PXNAME}/{#SVNAME} qtime
item_prototype.description: The average queue time in ms over the 1024 last requests.

item_prototype.name: Server {#PXNAME}/{#SVNAME} rate
item_prototype.description: The current rate, per second, at which connections are being established to the server.

item_prototype.name: Server {#PXNAME}/{#SVNAME} rate_lim
item_prototype.description: Configured limit on new sessions per second

item_prototype.name: Server {#PXNAME}/{#SVNAME} rate_max
item_prototype.description: The highest rate at which connections have ever been established to the given server.

item_prototype.name: Server {#PXNAME}/{#SVNAME} req_rate
item_prototype.description: HTTP requests per second over last elapsed second

item_prototype.name: Server {#PXNAME}/{#SVNAME} req_tot
item_prototype.description: Total number of HTTP requests received.

item_prototype.name: Server {#PXNAME}/{#SVNAME} rtime
item_prototype.description: The average response time in ms over the 1024 last requests (0 for TCP)

item_prototype.name: Server {#PXNAME}/{#SVNAME} scur
item_prototype.description: The number of active connections to a server.

item_prototype.name: Server {#PXNAME}/{#SVNAME} slim
item_prototype.description: The maximum number of connections allowed for a server, as set by the maxconn parameter on a server line.

item_prototype.name: Server {#PXNAME}/{#SVNAME} smax
item_prototype.description: The most connections that have ever been simultaneously established to the given server

item_prototype.name: Server {#PXNAME}/{#SVNAME} status
item_prototype.description: UP The server is reporting as healthy. DOWN The server is reporting as unhealthy and unable to receive requests. NOLB You’ve added http-check disable-on-404 to the backend and the health checked URL has returned an HTTP 404 response. MAINT The server has been disabled or put into maintenance mode. DRAIN The server has been put into drain mode. no check Health checks are not enabled for this server.

item_prototype.name: Server {#PXNAME}/{#SVNAME} stot
item_prototype.description: The cumulative number of connections that have used the given server.

item_prototype.name: Server {#PXNAME}/{#SVNAME} weight
item_prototype.description: The proportion of traffic it will accept, as set by the weight parameter on the server line.

item_prototype.name: Server {#PXNAME}/{#SVNAME} wredis
item_prototype.description: The number of times that HAProxy failed to establish a connection to a server and redispatched it to another server. This requires that you’ve added an option redispatch directive.

item_prototype.name: Server {#PXNAME}/{#SVNAME} wretr
item_prototype.description: The total number of times that a connection was retried.
